document.masterDocTitle: Review of the genus Scythropiodes Matsumura, 1931 (Lepidoptera, Lecithoceridae, Oditinae) from China, with a checklist of the world

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of the genus Scythropiodes Matsumura, 1931 (Lepidoptera, Lecithoceridae, Oditinae) from China, with a checklist of the world

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Odites malivora
Meyrick, 1930
: 555
. TL:
China
(Heilongjiang: Manchuria). TD: BMNH .
Odites xenophaea
Meyrick, 1931
: 74
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. Adult (
Fig. 14
) with wingspan 19.0–28.0 mm. This species is similar to
S. ussuriella
Lvovsky, 1996
, but differs from the latter in the male genitalia by the apical process of the valva being deeply concave at the base of the outer margin, and by the phallus having neither a process at distal 1 / 5 nor denticles preapically (
Fig. 29
). In
S. ussuriella
, the valva has an apical process shallowly concave at the base of the outer margin, and the phallus has a thorn-shaped process at distal 1 / 5 and two small preapical denticles (
Park & Wu 1997 :
Figs 17–18
).

Host plants. Euphorbiaceae :
Sapium sebiferum
; Fagaceae :
Castanea crenata
; Lythraceae :
Lagerstroemia indica
; Rosaceae :
Malus pumila
(
Park & Wu 1997
;
Sakamaki 2013
).
Moriuti ( 1982 )
mentioned that the larvae of this species were leaf-rollers.

Distribution.
China
(Anhui, Chongqing, Fujian, Gansu, Guangdong, Guizhou, Hebei, Heilongjiang, Henan, Hunan, Shandong, Sichuan, Tianjin , Yunnan, Zhejiang), Korea , Japan , Russia .
